data.title: 10 Best Assamese Movies That You Should Watch
data.meta_description: Here are some recent films from the Assamese film industry that are a must-watch for film enthusiasts.
data.text:
Directed by Rima Das, won the Swarna Kamal award for best-featured film at the 65th National Awards, and was India's official entry for the 92nd Academy Awards. It follows the story of a village girl named Dhunu who dreams of having her own rock band.

Directed by Sanjib Dey, is an original film that tells the story of three individuals - a young girl, a dropout engineering drug peddler, and a poor fisherman who becomes an elephant poacher due to government bans on fishing in protected areas.

Directed by Himjyoti Talukder, is a drama movie that features Moloya Goswami, Arun Nath, Gunjan Bhardwaj, and Rimjhim Deka. It won seven awards at the Prag Cine Awards North East 2018.

Directed by Dweep Chaudhary, is a drama movie that depicts the plight of daily wage laborers in Guwahati. It addresses burning topics like hill encroachment, man-leopard conflict, and displacement of farmers due to natural confusion.

Written and directed by Santwana Bardoloi, is a drama movie that won a special mention award for Adil Hussain's acting at the 64th National Awards. The movie features other cast members like Shakil Imtiaz, Mahendra Rabha, Sulakshana Baruah, Pranami Bora, and Kasvi Sharma.

Directed by Bhaskar Hazarika, is a dark and intense movie that is based on Lakshminath Bezbora's famous fables "Buri Aair Sadhu". It features actors like Adil Hussain, Urmila Mahanta, and Kapil Bora, and was selected as the best Feature film in Assamese in the 63rd National Award.

Directed by Kenny Deori Basumatary, is an entertaining movie that is dubbed India's first kung fu movie. It was made with a budget of only 95000 Rs and was shot with a Canon 550-D Camera. It also has a sequel called Local Kung Fu-2.

Directed by Himanshu Prasad Das, is a drama movie that features Baharul Islam, Pakija Begam, Pranjal Saikia, and Arun Nath in the lead roles. It has a user rating of 5-star on websites like end times and also features famous singers like Neel Akash, Dikshu Sharma, Deeplina Deka, and Angaraag Papon Mahanta.

Directed by Jatin Bora, features Jatin Bora, Barsha Rani Bishaya, Nishita Goswami, and Ashramika Saha in the lead roles. It has a user rating of 3.7-star on websites like end times and is based on drama and action.
